author: coar
msg: *SecurityDescriptor() should be returning an error on Win98, but
sometimes doesn't -- so check the last error if it claims all
went well, just in case it's fibbing.

author: fielding
msg: Fix handling of case when a client has sent "Expect: 100-continue"
and we are going to respond with an error, but get stuck waiting to
discard the body in the pointless hope of preserving the connection.
This remains less than satisfactory, since what we really should be
doing is sending the response immediately and discarding the request
body as some form of post-response cleanup.  Something to consider.
Submitted by:	Roy Fielding, Joe Orton <jeo101@york.ac.uk>

author: bjh
msg: OS/2: Fix spawning of CGI scripts to use appropriate type of command line

author: bjh
msg: Releasing a semaphore you don't own isn't a fatal error.

author: martin
msg: Avoid core dumps when no responses were received
